On 8/25/06, Kevin Lawrence <kev.lawrence@...> wrote:
>
>
> Setting a =
threshold that is not zero seems artificial and not very
> useful to me.
>
=

It can be...

TestNG lets you do this:

@Test(invocationCount =3D 1000, su=
ccessPercentageCount =3D 90)
public void foo() { }

... which will invoke t=
his method 1000 times and will only report a failure
if more than 100 fail.=


This feature was requested by users who do tests that are allowed to fail=

for a certain threshold, such as sending packets on an unreliable network.=


-- 
C=E9dric
